alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 7:29PM CST until January 29 at 12:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Denham Springs affecting East Baton Rouge and Livingston Parishes. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River at Denham Springs. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Flooding will begin in the westernmost parts of Denham Springs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Saturday the stage was 29.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Saturday was 29.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.4 feet just after midnight tonight then begin falling. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 130 PM CST.
